TopicTitle: The "You know you're playing a lot of KSP when..." thread

Articles.Content: After earning the 750 000 kerbucks to upgrade the launch pad in a extreme hard career practice game and thinking of retrying another practice run.

When you have a dream which combines KSP, Civ 4 and Minecraft.

Get advanced in minecraft. Launch a rocket to Duna for space race victory.

When going to the toilet at school, you imagine you are orbiting buildings and frequently blow air out of your mouth to stimulate RCS.
When you're able to start and end a video on it in three hours... XD
When the light turns green and you find yourself wanting to drive your car more fuel-efficiently by flooring it up to the speed limit and then coasting.
When your sisters play a space game with you and tell you not to corret for realism!
When you press ">" in a stream, in the hope that they'll start going faster
When you watch Elysium yesterday and it annoys you seeing them fly straight-line trips and talking about "Luftraum" (german for airspace) in space.

Every time I play KSP for an extended period of time I tell myself I'm burning prograde into a trajectory of no life... Let's just hope I have enough monopropellent to turn retrograde before it becomes an escape trajectory from reality.

Oh god what am I saying.
If something cool happens in real life, me and the Mrs. say "AAAWWRAAGHT" to each other like Gene.

When you start using orbital mechanics to describe work events. Say like....

If we are going to change the requirements, it is cheaper and easier to change them now rather than wait until just before implementation is done. Just like orbit changes in space take less dV if you do them earlier rather than later.
When you subconsciously start every google search with 'ksp' even when the search has nothing to do with it

When your significant other nicknames your youngest son Jeb because she claims heis eyes makes him resemble a kerbal. (True story)

When you read this and seriously consider naming your future son Jebediah K.

Don't get me started, Ksp is just one of those games you Have to play. I am a militaristic builder, so i have found myself with many Craft files that i constantly am updating because of me gaining a better understanding of the game. But that will eventually Stop? Right?
When your doctors tell you to exercise, because all the sitting is hurting your back...

When you're scared of jumping into a pool because you think you'll explode into sploosh.

When you angle yourself headfirst when falling to increase your chances of survival.

When you attribute spacecraft failures to the Kraken.

- - - Updated - - -

When you want to say "Joolian" instead of "Jovian."
When you measure fuel quantity in pixels.
when I can determine if I need to use Z or shift when the burn time is low
When you are walking somewhere and you wonder how much DeltaV your legs have.

...when you realise that if KSP was real life, you'd be getting 30x the salary of your *actual* day job.

To be honest though, my day job products are 30x less dangerous. I guess it balances out.

...when you realise that if KSP was real life, you'd be getting 30x the salary of your *actual* day job.

To be honest though, my day job products are 30x less dangerous. I guess it balances out.

Just 30x less dangerous???

... do you produce? Nukes?
When you hit the 100h mark on Steam within three weeks and realize you had to play TF2 for 2 years to have equal amount of time played.
I caught myself making the launch clamp release sound yesterday when I put my coffee cup in the sink. "KA-CHUNK!"
When you spend 3 hours on KSP every day, but more than 8 hours on the forums....help
When you stop at a lamp post and try to figure out why it has so many RCS ports. :/
When you're thinking "there's a lot of gravity here" when you're walking uphill.
